Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வசையென்ப வையத்தார்க் கெல்லாம் இசையென்னும்எச்சம் பெறாஅ விடின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Not to beget fame will be esteemed a disgrace by the wise in this world.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown at the end of their life.
Layered_Composition.Midground: They have failed to leave behind a legacy of fame or a good reputation ('இசை என்னும் எச்சம் பெறாவிடின்'). This is visualized as the space behind them being completely empty and barren. They have left no positive trace on the world.
Layered_Composition.Background: Because of this failure to create a worthy legacy, their entire life is judged to be a 'disgrace' ('வசை'). This is visualized by the entire world ('வையத்தார்') turning its back on them, and a permanent mark of shame appearing on their tombstone.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: For all the people of the world, a life that does not leave behind the legacy of a good name is considered a disgrace.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The legacy of fame as a tangible thing that is either present or absent is the key. The empty space behind the person is a powerful symbol of a life that made no positive impact. The world turning its back is the final verdict.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bleak, grey, and forgettable light. The scene is desaturated to emphasize the lack of any glorious or memorable achievement. The mark of shame is a stark, ugly black.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide, lonely shot that emphasizes the empty space behind the person, symbolizing their lack of a legacy.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, conveying a powerful sense of emptiness and failure.

Cultural_Anchors: If one does not obtain the legacy of fame (இசை என்னும் எச்சம் பெறாவிடின்)
